title: 364-C
statement: C. Beautiful Settime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstdinoutputstdoutWe'll call a set of positive integersabeautiful if the following condition fulfills: for any primep, if, then. In other words, if one number from the set is divisible by primep, then at least half of numbers from the set is divisible byp.Your task is to find any beautiful set, where the number of elements is equal tokand each element doesn't exceed2k2.InputThe first line contains integerk(10 ≤k≤ 5000) that shows how many numbers the required beautiful set should have.OutputIn the first line printkspace-separated integers that are a beautiful set. If there are multiple such sets, you are allowed to print any of them.ExamplesInput10Output16 18 24 27 36 48 54 72 108 144

processed.result:
You are given an integer $k$ (where $10 \le k \le 5000$).  

Find a set of $k$ positive integers that meet the following condition:

* For every prime number $p$, if any number in the set is divisible by $p$, then at least half of the numbers in the set must also be divisible by $p$.

Print the set of $k$ integers.  Each number in the set should not be greater than $2k^2$. If there are multiple possible sets, you can print any one of them.

Find a set of  'k' numbers, where each number is less than or equal to 2k², and following this rule: if a prime number divides any number in the set, then at least half the numbers in the set must also be divisible by that prime number.
